extraction_metadata.article_title: Growth of a platform business model as an entrepreneurial ecosystem and its effects on regional development

extracted_data.question_text: What is the name and definition of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Platform business model: A business model where platforms provide architectures to combine internal and external innovations in ways that create value throughout the chain of activities that deliver useful technology to the market. The article examines both Open Business Model (OBM) platforms and supplier Open Innovation (OI) platforms as types of platform business models.
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 4: 'Platforms provide architectures to combine internal and external innovations in ways that create value throughout the chain of activities that deliver useful technology to the market' | Page 6: 'customer platforms are similar to OBMs (Chesbrough, 2010, 2012, 2013). OBMs allow ideas to travel from invention to commercialization through at least two different companies and not just through a hosting company.' | Page 6: 'supplier platform triggers supplier-based OI or supplier OI'

extracted_data.question_text: What synonyms or alternative terms are used in the article to refer to this software business model?
extracted_data.extracted_value: open business model platform, OBM platform, supplier OI platform, entrepreneurial ecosystem, economic ecosystem, platform firm, OI/CI (Open Innovation/Closed Innovation) platform
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2: 'platform business models as economic ecosystems' | Page 5: 'An ecosystem hence can be defined as a network of interconnected organizations, connected to a focal firm or platform' | 'So, open business model (OBM) platform is a kind of entrepreneurial ecosystem.'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the main vertical segment or industry where the software business model presented in the article is applied?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Smartphone app store industry and hotel-booking platform industry
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2: 'the authors first analysed two platform entrepreneurial ecosystems in the smartphone app store industry (Google Play's Android market and Apple's App Store) and two ecosystems in the hotel-booking industry (Hotels.com and Booking.com).'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the target customer type of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: B2C (for app store platforms targeting end users/consumers), B2B SMB (for hotel platforms targeting hotels as customers)
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 8: 'Greater 'Openness to Customer' means that the platform has less direct control on the contacts and transactions between suppliers and customers' | Page 9: 'the user part only includes the (a) number of users' | Page 11: 'Hotels.com allows hotels (customers) to develop a system'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the typical size of offering companies that adopt this software business model as described in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Large technology corporations (Google, Apple) for app store platforms; Mix of large platforms (Hotels.com, Booking.com) serving diverse hotel sizes from big hotels to small guesthouses; In regional context, small and medium software firms and diverse entrepreneurs
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3: 'Google Play (Android market) and Apple's App Store' | Page 16: 'many small and diverse SW firms appeared in Daegu' | Page 17: 'small hotels including guesthouses with a history of less than five years are appearing diversely' | 'emerging of creative small hotels by entrepreneurs'

extracted_data.question_text: In which geographic region was the software business model presented in the article studied or applied?
extracted_data.extracted_value: South Korea, specifically Daegu Metropolitan City and Seoul
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2: 'we analysed the effects of platforms as entrepreneurial ecosystems on the regional development of Daegu Metropolitan City' | Page 11: 'within the Korean market through intensive interviews' | Page 11: 'the technological capability level of the Apple app platform business model is high (0.9) in the Korea Daegu market' | Page 14: 'hotel reservation platforms in Daegu and Seoul'

extracted_data.question_text: What specific customer segment is most detailed in the article regarding the software business model?
extracted_data.extracted_value: App developers as suppliers in smartphone platforms; Hotels (ranging from big hotels with 10+ year history to small guesthouses with less than 5 years) as suppliers in hotel-booking platforms; End users/consumers for both platform types
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 11: 'Apple acknowledges the passive iOS modification of developers' | Page 17: 'A group: Big hotels having more than 10-year history...B group: Big hotels having less than 5-year history...C group: Small hotels having more than 5-year history...D group: Small hotels having less than 5-year history' | Page 18: 'D group hotels mainly use Booking.com because they need user openness most of all'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the type of product or service offered by the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Platform, Application, Managed Service
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 4: 'Application distribution platforms or app stores, such as Google Play or Apple's App Store, allow developers and users to submit feedback' | Page 4: 'Several software (SW) platforms, such as smartphone app stores or hotel-booking platforms, drive innovation and transform industries' | Page 8: 'hotel-booking service platform business models'

extracted_data.question_text: How is the software delivered or deployed in the business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Multi-tenant SaaS (cloud-based platforms), Mobile (smartphone applications)
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 4: 'The electronic distribution of room information, prices, and availability has changed the channels that people use to reserve hotel rooms, from travel agents and hotel chains' call centres to using online booking platforms' | Page 5: 'Mobile application stores have revolutionized SW and content delivery' | Page 4: 'Application distribution platforms or app stores, such as Google Play or Apple's App Store'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the intellectual property regime adopted by the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Mixed approach with varying levels of openness: Apple uses more Proprietary/Closed Innovation approach; Android uses more Permissive Open Source approach with open codes and platform customizability
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 5: 'The Apple App Store disallows platform customizability, and applications that overlap with existing functions are rejected. At the other end of the spectrum, the Android store-based platform functions (e.g. keyboard, authentication) can be replaced by market applications.' | Page 11: 'Apple acknowledges the passive iOS modification of developers, but only for essential aspects, while Google opens the Android OS source to app developers and considerably acknowledges the free right to modify it.'

extracted_data.question_text: Are there specific restrictions or compatibilities of licensing mentioned in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Closed platform approach → Limits platform customizability and app functionality overlap | Open platform approach → Allows code modification and platform function replacement | Openness to suppliers affects percentage of verified suppliers and quality control
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 5: 'The Apple App Store disallows platform customizability, and applications that overlap with existing functions are rejected' | Page 4: 'There are two fundamentally distinct approaches to the opening of a technology platform...One kind of impact is granting access to a platform...The other is giving up control over the platform.' | Page 7: 'Apple's App Store and Google Play's Android market have the same level of openness to users, but they have different levels of openness to the supplier'

extracted_data.question_text: What are the revenue sources of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Transaction fees (commission on app sales and hotel bookings), Subscription (for app downloads), Usage/consumption (transaction-based revenue)
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 8: ''revenue collectivity' means 'the platform's abilities, or possibilities, of actually receiving transaction fee from customers and suppliers'' | Page 11: 'Apple receives all the rewards for apps and subsequently delivers them to developers with the commission deducted' | Page 12: 'Hotels.com receives the hotel lodging charge payment and then transfers it to the hotels with the commission deducted'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the base unit for pricing of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Transactions (per app sale or per booking transaction)
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 9: 'The revenue part has (a) revenue collectability, (b) amounts of total transaction, (c) amounts of verified transaction and (d) sales of platform.' | Page 7: 'If the quality of app in Apple's App Store increases, the number of verified transactions (i.e. paid app) increases.'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the price presentation structure of the software business model described in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Freemium (free and paid apps coexist), Custom negotiation (commission rates vary)
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 11: 'most Android apps are provided for free, and most of the rewards for app development are directly transferred to the app developers' | Page 7: 'talented app providers who stay in the App Store...the number of verified transactions (i.e. paid app) increases' | Page 14: 'Hotels.com is introducing a new sales strategy to substantially reduce the commission if existing or new hotel customers, who renew or make new contracts'

extracted_data.question_text: What currency and billing periodicity are used in the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: not reported
extracted_data.source_citation: information not found in text

extracted_data.question_text: What is the role of the offering company in the ecosystem of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Two-sided platform, Marketplace
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 5: 'An ecosystem hence can be defined as a network of interconnected organizations, connected to a focal firm or platform, which incorporates both production and use of side participants' | Page 8: 'the platform has less direct control on the contacts and transactions between suppliers and customers' | Page 4: 'online travel agents (OTAs), such as Booking.com, play an important role'

extracted_data.question_text: What type of network effect is present in the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Cross-sided (distinct groups benefit) - suppliers and customers benefit from each other's presence on the platform
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 9: 'both suppliers and customers have open platforms, which are connected through the casual loop of a feedback loop' | Page 10: '(R1) Openness to Supplier ↑→ Number of Supplier ↑→ Overall Value of Platform ↑' and '(R3) Openness to Customer ↑→ Number of Users ↑→ Overall Value of Platform ↑' | Page 2: 'from scope and scale economy-based firms leading regional development to creative economy-based firms'

extracted_data.question_text: What are the customer acquisition channels of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Marketplaces (app stores and booking platforms), Digital marketing (promotions and advertisements), Direct (platform access)
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 14: 'Hotels.com is making more advertisements and reinforcing promotion, including one free night for those who reserve over 10 nights' | Page 4: 'Application distribution platforms or app stores, such as Google Play or Apple's App Store, allow developers and users to submit feedback'

extracted_data.question_text: Does the software business model presented in the article use cloud marketplaces or platforms?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Yes - Google Play (Android market), Apple App Store, Hotels.com, Booking.com, and third-party Android marketplaces
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3: 'The authors analysed two platforms –Google Play (Android market) and Apple's App Store –in the smartphone app store platform business model industry. We also analysed two firms –Hotels.com and Booking.com –in the hotel-booking platform business model industry.' | Page 5: 'a number of third-party alternative marketplaces have also been created to host thousands of apps'

extracted_data.question_text: Which Business Model Canvas elements are detailed in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Value Proposition: Combining internal and external innovations, connecting suppliers and customers, facilitating transactions | Customer Segment: App developers, hotels, end users/consumers | Channels: App stores, online booking platforms, direct platform access | Relationship: Open/closed supplier relationships, open/closed customer relationships, commission-based | Revenue Streams: Transaction fees, commission on sales, verified transactions | Key Resources: Platform technology, supplier base, user base, technological capability, user trust | Key Activities: Platform management, quality control, transaction facilitation, innovation support | Key Partnerships: Suppliers (developers/hotels), complementary firms, regional clusters | Cost Structure: Platform investment, system quality maintenance, technology development
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 6: 'Platform firms generally have a supplier platform, a customer platform, and industrial characteristics' | Page 9: 'The decision part includes...OI/CI decision, OBM/HBM/CBM decision, openness to suppliers and openness to customer. The supplier part includes...amounts of supplier, percentage of verified supplier, amounts of app and service and quality. The user part only includes the number of users. The revenue part has revenue collectability, amounts of total transaction, amounts of verified transaction and sales of platform. The platform part has system quality of platform, investment into platform and overall value of platform.'

extracted_data.question_text: Which actors participate in the ecosystem of the software business model presented in the article and how do they interact?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Platform firms (Google, Apple, Hotels.com, Booking.com) | Central coordination role | Connect suppliers with customers, manage transactions, set openness policies | Suppliers (app developers, hotels) | Provide products/services | Submit apps/rooms to platform, receive revenue minus commission, benefit from platform access to users | Customers/Users | Consume products/services | Download apps or book hotels, provide feedback and reviews, pay for transactions | Regional clusters (Daegu SW cluster) | Support ecosystem | Provide infrastructure, enable firm networking and growth | Complementary firms | Enhance value | Integrate with platform through APIs and partnerships
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 6: 'Platform firms generally have a supplier platform, a customer platform' | Page 8: 'the platform has less direct control on the contacts and transactions between suppliers and customers' | Page 4: 'Leading platform owners have strongly focused on attracting and tying external complementary firms to their platforms' | Page 15: 'SW firms in Daegu changed from Daegu Digital Industry Promotion Agency (DIP) Cluster-based one pole congestion to congestion of diverse poles-based cluster'

extracted_data.question_text: What motivations lead to the adoption of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Access to large user base and markets; Reduced distribution barriers for apps and services; Ability to leverage platform infrastructure and reputation; Revenue opportunities through transaction fees; Competitive advantage through network effects; Regional development and innovation stimulation; Lower marketing costs for small suppliers; Global reach for local businesses
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 8: 'with OBM, 'Number of Customers' will increase because the platform will be under less control' | Page 18: 'Small creative hotels can easily invite customers from Seoul and foreign country customers without any additional marketing cost through Hotels.com and Booking.com' | Page 2: 'platform business models as economic ecosystems motivate a change of regional development from focused areas to multiple areas'

extracted_data.question_text: What factors contribute to the success of the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: High openness to suppliers → More suppliers and apps → Increased platform value | High openness to customers → More users → Increased transactions and platform value | Strong technological capability → Higher percentage of verified suppliers → Better quality | High user trust → More verified transactions → Higher sales | Balanced openness strategy → Optimal revenue collectability | Strong feedback loops (reinforcing loops) → Accelerated growth | Investment in platform quality → Better system → Higher overall value
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 10: '(R1) Openness to Supplier ↑→ Number of Supplier ↑→ Overall Value of Platform ↑' | '(R3) Openness to Customer ↑→ Number of Users ↑→ Overall Value of Platform ↑' | Page 11: 'With more technological capability, a platform can technologically and deeply support more suppliers. By this, the percentage of verified suppliers will increase' | 'With more user trust, the more wiliness a user will have to buy a more verified transaction that requires more payment'

extracted_data.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Technological capability → Influences supply side and platform quality | User trust → Influences user side and platform sales | Platform infrastructure and system quality → Enables transactions | Critical mass of suppliers and users → Creates network effects | Openness strategy aligned with industry characteristics → Hardware requires more technological capability, services require more user trust | Regional innovation system support → Cluster infrastructure for growth
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 10: 'through intensive interviews...we anticipate that the importance of 'technological capability' and 'user trust' will be different in accordance with the industry characteristics' | Page 11: 'Technological capability is an important factor that influences a percentage of the verified supplier and, eventually, the overall value of the platform' | 'User trust is an important factor that influences the 'amounts of verified transaction' and platform sales'

extracted_data.question_text: What restrictions or incompatibilities are mentioned in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.extracted_value: High openness to suppliers → Lower percentage of verified suppliers → Reduced quality (Balancing Loop B1) | High openness to customers → Lower revenue collectability → Reduced investment capacity (Balancing Loop B3) | Closed innovation approach → Fewer apps and suppliers → Limited variety | Platform customization restrictions → Limits supplier flexibility | Trade-off between diversity and control → Cannot maximize both simultaneously | Industry-specific constraints → Hardware platforms need different strategies than service platforms
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 4: 'When a technological system continues to innovate after it has been opened, a new trade-off, which might be referred to as 'diversity versus control', will occur' | Page 10: '(B1) Openness to Supplier ↑→ Percentage of Verified Suppliers ↓→ Quality of App/Service ↓' | '(B3) Openness to Customer ↑→ Revenue Collectability ↓→ Sales of Platform ↓' | Page 5: 'The Apple App Store disallows platform customizability'

extracted_data.question_text: What challenges are identified in implementing the software business model as presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Balancing openness versus control and revenue collectability; Managing quality when highly open to suppliers; Risk of platform disruption from competitors (Hotels.com being overtaken by Booking.com); Maintaining verified supplier percentages with high openness; Building and maintaining user trust especially for new platforms; Technological capability requirements varying by industry; Managing transition impacts on existing regional cluster structures (DIP dissolution risk); Coordinating multiple stakeholders in ecosystem; Strategic timing of openness policy changes
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 4: 'a new trade-off, which might be referred to as 'diversity versus control'' | Page 8: 'the disadvantage of OBM is having less revenue collectability' | Page 14: 'Hotels.com would have long been chased by Booking.com after a certain time and then taken over by it' | Page 16: 'DIP, which was the core institute of Daegu SW cluster, is in a dangerous situation right now. DIP is in dissolving situation'

extracted_data.question_text: What practices are used to mitigate challenges of the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Adjusting customer openness to improve revenue collectability → Android reducing openness from 0.9 to 0.7 → Increased profit | Hotels.com adopting payment-on-arrival model → Matching Booking.com's customer openness (0.9) → Maintaining competitiveness | Promotion and advertising to build user trust → Hotels.com offering free nights → User retention improvement | Quality control through preliminary assessment → Apple's 2-3 week app review → Higher quality apps | Balancing supplier and customer openness → Optimizing overall platform value | Regional cluster restructuring → From hierarchical to network structure → Better adaptation to market changes
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 13: 'The above is a simulation wherein the Android platform business directly receives the revenue made by the applications...in order to reduce the customer OI rate of Android. The customer's openness rate of Android Platform was accordingly reduced from 0.9 to 0.7...the Android app store may take over Apple's App Store for revenue collectability' | Page 14: 'Hotels.com is introducing a new sales strategy to substantially reduce the commission if existing or new hotel customers...decide to receive a room charge upon the users' arrival' | Page 14: 'Hotels.com is making more advertisements and reinforcing promotion, including one free night for those who reserve over 10 nights'

extracted_data.question_text: What metrics and quantitative results are reported in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Supplier openness rate Apple; 0.5; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Six interviewee firms | Supplier openness rate Android; 0.9; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Six interviewee firms | Customer openness rate Apple; 0.5; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Six interviewee firms | Customer openness rate Android; 0.9; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Six interviewee firms | Supplier openness Hotels.com; 0.9; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Four big hotels | Supplier openness Booking.com; 0.1; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Four big hotels | Customer openness Hotels.com; 0.5; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Six hotels | Customer openness Booking.com; 0.9; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Six hotels | Technological capability Apple; 0.9; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Daegu market | Technological capability Android; 0.5; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Daegu market | User trust Hotels.com; 0.9; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Daegu market | User trust Booking.com; 0.5; Scale 0-1; 2015; Interview; Daegu market | Number of SW firms in Daegu clusters; 6 clusters; Count; 2015-2016; Observation; Regional analysis | Number of hotel categories in Daegu; 4 groups; Count; 2016; Booking.com search; 27 May 2016 | Hotels in D group; 16; Count; 2016; Booking.com; Small hotels < 5 years
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 11: 'the supplier's OI level is 0.5 for Apple, while it is 0.9 for Google...the customer's OI is only 0.5...the OBM, that is, customer OI level, is 0.9' | Page 12: 'the supplier's OI is 0.9 for Hotels.com, while it is 0.1 for Booking.com...customer OI, is 0.5 for the former and 0.9 for the latter' | Page 13: 'the technological capability level of the Apple app platform business model is high (0.9) in the Korea Daegu market, while it is still 0.5 for Android' | Page 17: 'The number of hotels which belong to D group is 16'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Observed period: 2015-2016 (interviews conducted in 2015, regional analysis through 2016) | Maturity status: Growing to Consolidated (platforms are established and causing regional transformation, though still evolving strategically)
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 23: 'Interview date 2015.05.06...2015.05.13...2015.05.14...2015.04.29' | Page 17: 'Source: 27 May 2016 Booking.com hotels in Daegu' | Page 2: 'platform business models as economic ecosystems motivate a change of regional development' | Page 5: 'Recent years have witnessed incredible popularity and adoption of smartphones and mobile devices'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the type of evidence presented in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Multiple cases (comparing Google Play, Apple App Store, Hotels.com, Booking.com), with additional methods including simulation, interviews, and literature review
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2: 'We used in-depth interview methods with a semi-structured questionnaire, system dynamics (SD) simulation, a literature review, and a statistical analysis as research methods.' | Page 3: 'The authors analysed two platforms –Google Play (Android market) and Apple's App Store...We also analysed two firms –Hotels.com and Booking.com' | Page 3: 'This study used interview methods, brainstorming, literature reviews, simulation, and statistical analysis together'

extracted_data.question_text: Which companies or products are cited as examples of the software business model in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Google Play (Android market) → Main case study of open platform approach in app stores | Apple App Store → Main case study of more closed platform approach in app stores | Hotels.com → Case study of hotel platform with high supplier openness and medium customer openness | Booking.com → Case study of hotel platform with low supplier openness and high customer openness | Busang Systems → App development firm interviewed in Daegu | Neuron Works → App development firm interviewed in Daegu | AR Media Works → App development firm interviewed in Daegu | Daegu Grand Hotel → Hotel interviewed using platforms | IBIS Seoul Myeongdong → Hotel interviewed using platforms | Bayern Innovative, EcoPlus, Marche → Regional innovation platforms mentioned
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3: 'The authors analysed two platforms –Google Play (Android market) and Apple's App Store...We also analysed two firms –Hotels.com and Booking.com' | Page 23: 'Interview date 2015.05.06 Busang Systems...2015.05.13 Neuron Works...2015.05.13 AR Media Works...2015.04.29 Daegu Grand Hotel...2015.05.19 IBIS Seoul Myeongdong' | Page 6: 'Several regional innovation platforms such as Bayern Innovative, EcoPlus, Marche were analysed'

extracted_data.question_text: Are there variations or subtypes of the software business model described in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Open Innovation (OI) platform → High openness to suppliers (0.9), many suppliers but lower quality control | Closed Innovation (CI) platform → Low openness to suppliers (0.1-0.5), fewer suppliers but higher quality | Open Business Model (OBM) platform → High openness to customers (0.9), more users but lower revenue collectability | Half-open Business Model (HBM) platform → Medium openness to customers (0.5), balanced approach | Closed Business Model (CBM) platform → Low openness to customers (0.1), higher revenue control but fewer users | Industry-specific variations → Hardware platforms emphasize technological capability, Service platforms emphasize user trust, Software platforms balance both
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 7: 'Apple: closed innovation (CI)...Android: OI' | Page 8: 'Booking.com: OBM...Hotels.com: HBM' | Page 9: 'The decision part includes the following: (a) OI/closed innovation (CI) decision, (b) OBM/HBM/CBM decision' | Page 11: 'The sequencing of the importance of technological capability among industries is as follows: Hardware > SW (App Market etc.) > Service (Hotel Reservation etc.)'

extracted_data.question_text: What future trends or evolutions are mentioned in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Android platform considering reducing customer openness to improve revenue collectability; Hotels.com adopting payment-on-arrival model to compete with Booking.com; Evolution from hierarchical to network structures in regional clusters; Expansion from single-pole to multi-pole regional development; Emergence of diverse small creative businesses enabled by platforms; Different platforms will trigger different effects on regional innovation systems; Explosive emergence of different platform businesses worldwide; Need to understand platform business differences by industry and effects on regional systems
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 13: 'It is important to highlight the strategy that the Google Play platform recently considered and tried or practically reinforced the limitations with regard to in-app purchases' | Page 14: 'At present, in the Korea Seoul major market and small Daegu market, Hotels.com is introducing a new sales strategy' | Page 2: 'platform business models as economic ecosystems motivate a change of regional development from focused areas to multiple areas, from a hierarchical structure of firms to a network of diverse firms' | Page 20: 'different platform businesses are recently and explosively emerging all over the world'
